classification.name: Bladder Pathology Unified Classification
classification.purpose: Provide a single-source, hierarchical classification for all bladder (urothelial and non-urothelial) specimens — from normal / reactive findings through benign lesions and the full malignant spectrum — to support consistent reporting, data capture, and treatment decision-making.

decision_tree.criteria: No neoplastic process; purely inflammatory or reactive changes (bacterial, radiation, eosinophilic, interstitial cystitis, etc.)
Urothelial papilloma, inverted papilloma, cystitis cystica / glandularis
Urothelial proliferation of uncertain malignant potential (UPUMP) / atypical urothelial proliferation (AUP)
examples: Flat urothelial hyperplasia with atypia insufficient for malignancy

decision_tree.criteria: Low-grade Ta > 3 cm, multifocal, recurs ≤ 12 mo, or low-grade T1
examples: Three 4 cm low-grade Ta tumours recurring at 8 mo

decision_tree.criteria: High-grade Ta (any size), high-grade T1, or carcinoma in situ (Tis)
examples: 2 cm high-grade T1 invading lamina propria

decision_tree.criteria: U3 plus ≥ 1 modifier: BCG-unresponsive, aggressive variant (micropapillary, plasmacytoid, nested, sarcomatoid, small-cell / neuroendocrine), lymphovascular invasion, or prostatic-urethral involvement
examples: Persistent high-grade T1 after adequate BCG
Two obturator nodes (N2) with T3b primary

decision_tree.criteria: Any T / N, non-regional lymph-node metastasis only
examples: Para-aortic nodal spread; no visceral disease

decision_tree.criteria: Any T / N, visceral or bone metastasis
Pure squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, urachal carcinoma, neuroendocrine carcinoma, or other non-urothelial histology

modifiers_glossary.name: BCG-unresponsive
modifiers_glossary.definition: Persistent or recurrent CIS, Ta, or T1 high-grade disease within 6 months of completing adequate BCG (≥ 5/6 induction and ≥ 2/3 maintenance instillations) — or T1/HG recurrence at first evaluation post-induction — per NCCN v1.2025 and EAU 2025 guidance.

modifiers_glossary.name: Aggressive variants
modifiers_glossary.definition: Micropapillary, plasmacytoid, nested, sarcomatoid, small-cell / neuroendocrine, giant-cell, lymphoma-like, lipid-rich.

modifiers_glossary.name: Lymphovascular invasion (LVI)
modifiers_glossary.definition: Tumour cells within vascular or lymphatic channels.

modifiers_glossary.name: Prostatic-urethral involvement
modifiers_glossary.definition: CIS or invasive carcinoma extending into prostatic urethral mucosa or ducts.

narrative_mapping.narrative: Low-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma, no lamina propria invasion
Multiple low-grade Ta tumours up to 4 cm
High-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma invades lamina propria
High-grade papillary urothelial carcinoma, no LP invasion, CIS present
Persistent high-grade T1 after adequate BCG
Urothelial carcinoma with two obturator lymph-node metastases
Metastatic urothelial carcinoma, para-aortic nodal disease
Primary squamous cell carcinoma of bladder

reporting_template.pattern: <Code> (<T N M>, Grade <low/high>, Size cm, Multifocal <yes/no>, Variant <type>, Modifiers <list>)
reporting_template.example: U3+ (T1 HG N0 M0, size 2 cm, LVI+, BCG-unresponsive)

references: WHO Classification of Tumours, Urinary System & Male Genital Organs, 5th ed.
EAU Guidelines on Non-muscle-invasive and Muscle-invasive Bladder Cancer (2025)
